column3: Faculty of Health, Science, Social Care and Education
column5: Why choose this course?This course will introduce you to key concepts of haematopoietic stem cells and normal blood cell production through to disease processes, diagnosis and personalised treatments.During your time at Kingston, the course offers guidance and preparation for your future IBMS registration. An extended research project will enable you to pursue an area of interest in depth.The course is delivered two days per week, and with part-time options, can help you fit your studies around other commitments.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years full time including professional placement, 2 years part time
